item.title:
Holesky and other testnets exist to find issues.
Excited that Reth & Erigon worked well, and IMO NBD for other teams. Shit happens. We fix and keep shipping as one team. Highly recommend Reth in prod.
Would it have been better had no client had a bug? Sure.
Was the bug easy to find? Yes.
Does it mean we should go slower? No.

item.title:
RT by @gakonst: Two ways:
1) hire 3 A people to work remotely. You pay them a lot, and they will laugh at you if you tell them they have to work weekends because as a startup you simply can't afford paying for that. Then you let _them_ get turbo autistic and work non stop because they naturally crave ownership and are proud of their work.
2) hire a bunch of kids with no other responsibilities you need to constantly wrangle in an office. Some of them will turn out to be exceptional, most of them will have to be constantly micromanaged.
Both can work. You can't tell me 1) doesn't work because you've never tried and the default is to brute force 2).

item.title:
RT by @gakonst: Agree to disagree on this one.
As someone intense to a fault who has to actually refrain from DMing people on weekends, guarantee you that location has nothing to do with it.
The water cooler neural network thing I've never bought. I'm terminally online with some of my colleagues, and even with some people from the ecosystem I have no direct biz relationship with. IRC/discord/slack/whatever works. Write everything down.
What you need isn't an office, but high agency people who care and feel like they're going to be rewarded for their effort.
I will agree that if you hire a bunch of inexperienced kids or people who just want a job and don't care, sure it might be marginally more effective to micro manage them from their desk.
